contentrichtext.text: {{Single infobox | | Name = You Lay a Whole Lot of Love on Me | Artist = [[Shania Twain]] | from Album = [[Shania Twain (album)|Shania Twain]] | Cover = Shania Twain - You Lay a Whole Lot of Love on Me.png | B-side = "God Ain't Gonna Getcha for That" | Released = September 1993 | Genre = [[Country music|Country]] | Length = 2:48 | Label = [[Mercury Nashville Records|Mercury Nashville]] | Writer = Hank Beach,<br>Forest Borders II | Producer = Harold Shedd,<br>[[Norro Wilson]] | Last single = "[[Dance with the One That Brought You]]"<br>(1993) | This single = "You Lay a Whole Lot of Love on Me"<br>(1993) | Next single = "[[Whose Bed Have Your Boots Been Under?]]"<br>(1995) }} '''"You Lay a Whole Lot of Love on Me"''' is a song written by Hank Beach and Forest Borders II. It has been recorded by [[Con Hunley]], [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]] and [[Shania Twain]]. Con Hunley's version was on his 1980 release, ''I Don't Want to Lose You''. "You Lay a Whole Lot of Love on Me" was the album's second single, and reached number 19 on Billboard's Hot Country Singles chart.<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r172450|pure_url=yes}} All Music]</ref> Tom Jones's version was on his 1983 album, ''Don't Let Our Dreams Die Young''.<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r25479|pure_url=yes}} All Music]</ref> Arne Benoni's version was on his album ''As for You'', released 1991. ==Shania Twain version== Shania Twain's version was on her [[Shania Twain (album)|self-titled debut album]], released in 1993. "You Lay a Whole Lot of Love on Me" was the album's third and final single. The single failed to chart. ===Track listing=== '''US 7" single''' (Mercury 422-862) #"You Lay a Whole Lot of Love On Me" #"God Ain't Gonna Getcha for That" ===Music video=== A video directed by [[Steven Goldman]] was filmed in [[Montreal]], [[Canada]], August 1993 and released in September 1993.
